page.title: 05HOUSING IN BEDWORTH
page.content: {HOUSING}falls into 2 categories,rented & owner occupied.The western area contains more rented property;the eastern is predominately owner occupied.Housing near to Newdigate Pit (west of area) was built for the miners.A few houses were built around 1900 when the pit opened, but the new estate of 3-400 semi-detached houses & flats was built by the National Coal Board in the 1950's & 60's.The council then purchased them & now many people are buying their homes & doing improvements like double glazing,gas fires etc.Elsewhere there is a mixture of mostly private housing & a few council estates.There are many semi-detached dwellings.There is a contrast in older houses along Coventry Road & Newtown Road & the comparatively new estates eg.Cedars. Building is still in progress.
